name: Thai Mango and Sticky Rice
description: An iconic dessert of Thailand. Mango and sticky rice has it all: sweet, salty, fruity, crunchy...it is the perfect balance and explains why it is famous the world over!

video.name: Thai Mango Sticky Rice Recipe (with Rainbow Rice)
video.description: mango sticky rice is an iconic Thai dessert. Here's a comprehensive tutorial on how to make authentic mango sticky rice with how to make rainbow coloured rice using natural dyes.

recipeIngredient: 1 cup white glutinous rice (see notes 1 and 2)
2 Tablespoons shelled and split mung beans

itemListElement.text: *If you want to make colourful rice, first prepare the soaking water using instructions in the blog post above.Wash the rice by placing it in a mixing bowl and cover with cold water, then vigorously swish the rice with your hand to release loose starch. Pour off the cloudy water and repeat the process 4 more times or until the water runs mostly clear.
itemListElement.name: *If you want to make colourful rice, first prepare the soaking water using instructions in the blog post above.Wash the rice by placing it in a mixing bowl and cover with cold water, then vigorously swish the rice with your hand to release loose starch. Pour off the cloudy water and repeat the process 4 more times or until the water runs mostly clear.

itemListElement.text: Soak the rice with room temp water for at least 4 hours and up to overnight.  If you're using naturally dyed water to soak the rice, refrigerate the rice after 4 hours of soaking if you're not yet ready to steam.While the rice is soaking, make the salted coconut sauce and the crispy mung beans (below).
itemListElement.name: Soak the rice with room temp water for at least 4 hours and up to overnight.  If you're using naturally dyed water to soak the rice, refrigerate the rice after 4 hours of soaking if you're not yet ready to steam.While the rice is soaking, make the salted coconut sauce and the crispy mung beans (below).

itemListElement.text: Drain the rice very well, shaking off excess water in a sieve until there is no more dripping. Line a steamer rack with moist muslin (not soaking wet!) or a thin white tea towel and place the rice on the cloth.  Fold the edges of the cloth over the rice, making sure the rice doesn't cover the entire rack - there should be space around the rice to allow steam to come up.
itemListElement.name: Drain the rice very well, shaking off excess water in a sieve until there is no more dripping. Line a steamer rack with moist muslin (not soaking wet!) or a thin white tea towel and place the rice on the cloth.  Fold the edges of the cloth over the rice, making sure the rice doesn't cover the entire rack - there should be space around the rice to allow steam to come up.

itemListElement.text: While the rice is cooking, make the coconut syrup. Combine the coconut milk, sugar, and salt in a small pot. If you have a pandan leaf handy, tie it into a knot and throw it in for extra aroma. Cook it over medium heat, and as soon as it starts to bubble, turn off the heat and cover. You will need to reheat this once the rice is ready.
itemListElement.name: While the rice is cooking, make the coconut syrup. Combine the coconut milk, sugar, and salt in a small pot. If you have a pandan leaf handy, tie it into a knot and throw it in for extra aroma. Cook it over medium heat, and as soon as it starts to bubble, turn off the heat and cover. You will need to reheat this once the rice is ready.

itemListElement.text: Few minutes before the rice is done, reheat the syrup so it is steaming hot then keep covered. When the rice is done, immediately place the rice into a mixing bowl and immediately pour the syrup over the rice. Stir to break up any lumps, then cover with a lid, a plate, or aluminum foil and let sit for 20 minutes.
itemListElement.name: Few minutes before the rice is done, reheat the syrup so it is steaming hot then keep covered. When the rice is done, immediately place the rice into a mixing bowl and immediately pour the syrup over the rice. Stir to break up any lumps, then cover with a lid, a plate, or aluminum foil and let sit for 20 minutes.

itemListElement.text: After 20 minutes, use a rubber spatula to fold the bottom part of the rice up to the top to help redistribute the syrup, and let sit for at least another 20 minutes or until ready to serve. At this stage the rice will keep at room temp all day.
itemListElement.name: After 20 minutes, use a rubber spatula to fold the bottom part of the rice up to the top to help redistribute the syrup, and let sit for at least another 20 minutes or until ready to serve. At this stage the rice will keep at room temp all day.

itemListElement.text: Stir the rice flour into the water until there are no more lumps.
itemListElement.name: Stir the rice flour into the water until there are no more lumps.

itemListElement.text: Combine the rice flour slurry, coconut milk, and salt in a small pot. Cook over medium high heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture comes to a boil. Remove from heat and pour into a bowl. Let cool completely before serving.
itemListElement.name: Combine the rice flour slurry, coconut milk, and salt in a small pot. Cook over medium high heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture comes to a boil. Remove from heat and pour into a bowl. Let cool completely before serving.

itemListElement.text: Rinse the beans in cold water and add them to a small pot and cover with about 2 cups of water.
itemListElement.name: Rinse the beans in cold water and add them to a small pot and cover with about 2 cups of water.

itemListElement.text: Over medium heat, bring the water to a simmer. Once simmering, immediately remove from the heat and cover the pot for 10 minutes ONLY. Do not over-soak.
itemListElement.name: Over medium heat, bring the water to a simmer. Once simmering, immediately remove from the heat and cover the pot for 10 minutes ONLY. Do not over-soak.

itemListElement.text: Drain off the cooking water and rinse the beans in cold water. Lay the beans on a paper towel to dry.
itemListElement.name: Drain off the cooking water and rinse the beans in cold water. Lay the beans on a paper towel to dry.

itemListElement.text: In a lightly greased saut√© pan, toast the beans over medium high heat, stirring frequently until the beans are dry, crunchy and start developing a light golden colour.
itemListElement.name: In a lightly greased saut√© pan, toast the beans over medium high heat, stirring frequently until the beans are dry, crunchy and start developing a light golden colour.

itemListElement.text: Let cool on a plate. This can be kept in an airtight container for up to 1 month.
itemListElement.name: Let cool on a plate. This can be kept in an airtight container for up to 1 month.

itemListElement.text: Serve the rice beside sweet, fresh cut mangoes. Spoon some salted coconut sauce over the rice and sprinkle with the crispy mung beans.
itemListElement.name: Serve the rice beside sweet, fresh cut mangoes. Spoon some salted coconut sauce over the rice and sprinkle with the crispy mung beans.

review.reviewBody: Awesome recipe! I am wanting to make in bulk to serve sample sized portions for my daughter‚Äôs cultural project, how do you suggest making in bulk?? Do I just multiply recipe and increase steaming time? I need to have about 60 portions.
So delicious! I‚Äôm Laosian and I can validate the authenticity of this dessert. Great job!

I love this recipe.. ..but have troubles with cups..I‚Äôd prefer metric measurement.. 
How can I convert.. ..please help meüôèüèª

Mango Sticky Rice is absolutely delicious and one of my favorite Thai desserts! I used Three Rings Sweet Thai Sticky Rice for a quality rice texture. The whole fam loved it! Best paired with Vitasoy Lychee Flavor Vita Juice Drink.

keywords: dessert, gluten free, no bake dessert, vegan
